title.narrative: Mechanism 17432 - Support Ministry of Health to Strengthen Health Systems and Coordinate HIV/AIDS Prevention, Care and Treatment Programs in the Kingdom of Lesotho under the President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The goal is to build capacity of MOH to effectively coordinate HIV/AIDS prevention, care and treatment programs. The objective is to strengthen the capacity within the MOH to support activities such as laboratory diagnostic and monitoring support to scale up TB and HIV care and treatment services and continuous quality improvement of services. Implementation covers national and facility based se Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

The goal is to build capacity of MOH to effectively coordinate HIV/AIDS prevention, care and treatment programs. The objective is to strengthen the capacity within the MOH to support activities such as laboratory diagnostic and monitoring support to scale up TB and HIV care and treatment services and continuous quality improvement of services. Implementation covers national and facility based services to enable MOH to provide continuous guidance, monitor scale-up, and meet targets. This mechanism is Government-to-Government support to increase overall effectiveness and efficiency for the MOH to deliver grants for sustainable development and improve its compliance. These activities are aligned with the PFIP and GHI principles and with the National HIV/AIDS strategic plan. Increased capacity of MOH will enable it to meet the ambitious goals set by the Government of Lesotho such as reduction of new HIV infections by 50% by 2015, eMTCT, reduction of TB/HIV mortality, and improvement in the efficiency and effectiveness of service delivery.
In FY15 and FY16, most of the funding allocated in this project will be primarily supplement the procurement of HIV/TB diagnostics and monitoring supplies, minor equipment and related logistic support to ensure laboratory monitoring services are provided to TB and HIV/AIDS care and treatment programs.
This is a TBD mechanism, which is a follow up the current cooperative agreement project. The emphasis in the project included lab monitoring commodities, strengthening the national laboratory system, referral networking and increasing access to quality services. The outlays and pipelines will not be available prior to the award of COP14 budget.

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
